DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) is effective in the treatment of tinnitus.
DOC.brief_title: Therapeutic Effect of Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulaton on Tinnitus
DOC.criteria: Subjective tinnitus Age 18 years and older Meniere, conductive hearing loss, objective tinnitus History of seizure disorder or epilepsy Clinically relevant psychiatric comorbidity Previous symptomatic stroke Surgically or traumatically implanted foreign bodies such as a pacemaker, an implanted medication pump, a metal plate in the skull, or metal inside the skull or eyes (other than dental appliances or fillings), intracardiac lines that may pose a physical hazard during magnetic stimulation
